snippet: Intercepted electronic communications in which senior operatives of Al Qaeda discussed attacks in the Middle East and North Africa led the United States to issue a global travel alert to its citizens, officials said.
abstract: United States intercepts electronic communications among senior operatives of Al Qaeda, in which the terrorists discuss attacks on American interests in the Middle East and North Africa, prompting the State Department to issue a global travel alert; threat is deemed real, advanced and imminent, but the target is unknown.
lead_paragraph: Intercepted electronic communications in which senior operatives of Al Qaeda discussed attacks in the Middle East and North Africa led the United States to issue a global travel alert to its citizens, officials said.

headline.main: Qaeda Messages Prompt U.S. Terror Warning
headline.print_headline: Qaeda Messages Prompt U.S. Terror Warning
